title: CRISPR/defense system sequence element detector
description: This feature specifically detects sequence motifs associated with CRISPR systems and genome defense mechanisms. The feature shows strong, sharp activation spikes at positions coinciding with CRISPR repeats, spacers, or nearby CRISPR-associated genes. This likely represents detection of a conserved sequence signature important for genome defense against foreign genetic elements. The pattern is highly consistent across examples, appearing as a discrete spike rather than broad activation. The feature is active across diverse bacterial phyla including Proteobacteria, Firmicutes, and Archaea, suggesting it detects a universally conserved element of microbial genome defense systems.
